Articles.Content:
I did a quick check and did not see this. I had the idea on the way home from a late night server call. I had the thought of having like a multi-player aspect.

Say a friend and I decide to team up at the same time and launch our rockets, dock, land on planet x, build a base, etc. Granted, longer missions would be an issue and time warp would be needed. As for close stuff, I think it could be doable and give another layer of fun to the game.

You're about to get yelled at by some people

Look at the what not to suggest list and have a look at the planned features list on the wiki. Multiplayer is something they're not going to think about 'till after the game releases and it's not a guarantee that they'll ever implement any kind of multiplayer just 'cause it'd be a pain in the tush to work out

That said, small-scale coop like mooonbase alpha would be fun. I've suggested that before...but nobody seems to like that idea all that much. Or at least, nobody seems to respond when I throw that out there XD

Go figure.

I was mulling it over in me head on the hour drive back home and thought it would be interesting. I can see how it would be a huge undertaking but, would be well worth it when finished. If it is to be, then it is to be. If not, oh well.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/36863-What-not-to-suggest right on top in the stickies, and you didn't see it?

You're either blind or willfully incompetent.

Since this is in the what not to suggest list under "Multiplayer", thread locked.

Have a nice day.
